bug.author: arraydude
bug.summary: Streamlit hello not working on Python 3.8
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Running streamlit hello crashes on frontend side <denchmark-code>File "/Users/nahuelrosso/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-zainfNzj/lib/python3.8/site-packages/streamlit/hello/hello.py", line 18 from __future__ import division, unicode_literals ^ SyntaxError: from __future__ imports must occur at the beginning of the file </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/631997/68808715-1866f000-0649-11ea-8e9e-041f323aed99.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
run streamlit hello Wait for the frontend Check alert box
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Streamlit hello must show the hello example <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Crashes <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Python version: 3.8.0 OS version: All
